revision.text:
This is the main landing page for the public wiki.
Further information about the MetaNet project, as well as links to selected publications can be accessed via the MetaNet webpage: https://metanet.icsi.berkeley.edu/metanet/

This is the main landing page for the public wiki.
The MetaNet Project, currently housed at the International Computer Science Institute in Berkeley, California, is a collaboration across multiple teams and campuses to systematize metaphor analysis in a computational way.
This publicly-accessible MetaNet Metaphor Wiki is a repository of some of the key metaphors and frames that have been developed as part of this project.
Further information about the MetaNet project, as well as links to selected publications can be accessed via the MetaNet webpage: https://metanet.icsi.berkeley.edu/metanet/

This is the main landing page for the public wiki.
The MetaNet Project, currently housed at the International Computer Science Institute in Berkeley, California, is a collaboration across multiple teams and campuses to systematize metaphor analysis in a computational way. As part of this project, we have developed a formalization of Conceptual Metaphor Theory, and have used this to create a structured repository of metaphors and frames.
A small selection of this repository is available via this website.
The list of available metaphors can be found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]]. The list of available frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]].
By selecting an individual frame or metaphor from this list, you can view its internal structure, along with its specified relations to other frames and metaphors within the network. Because this is only a subset of the full repository, some of the links on these pages (links in red) are not live links.
Further information about the MetaNet project, as well as links to selected publications can be accessed via the MetaNet webpage: https://metanet.icsi.berkeley.edu/metanet/

The MetaNet Project, currently housed at the International Computer Science Institute in Berkeley, California, is a collaboration across multiple teams and campuses to systematize metaphor analysis in a computational way. As part of this project, we have developed a formalization of Conceptual Metaphor Theory, and have used this to create a structured repository of metaphors and frames.
A small selection of this repository is available via this website. In the near future, we plan to increase the number
The list of available metaphors can be found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]].
The list of available frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]].
By selecting an individual frame or metaphor from this list, you can view its internal structure, along with its specified relations to other frames and metaphors within the network. Because this is only a subset of the full repository, some of the links on these pages (links in red) are not live links.
While none of the pages are editable, viewers are invited to leave comments using the 'Discussion' tab for a given page.
Further information about the MetaNet project, as well as links to selected publications can be accessed via the MetaNet webpage: https://metanet.icsi.berkeley.edu/metanet/

The MetaNet Project, currently housed at the International Computer Science Institute in Berkeley, California, is a collaboration across multiple teams and campuses to systematize metaphor analysis in a computational way. As part of this project, we have developed a formalization of Conceptual Metaphor Theory, and have used this to create a structured repository of metaphors and frames.
This website currently contains beta versions of a selection of frames and metaphors from the full repository. In the future, we plan to continue to refine the content of these selected frames and metaphors. In addition, we will periodically be expanding the inventory of frames and metaphors that are made available at this site.
The list of currently available metaphors can be found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]].
The list of currently available frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]].
By selecting an individual frame or metaphor from this list, you can view its internal structure, along with its specified relations to other frames and metaphors within the network. Because this is only a subset of the full repository, some of the links on these pages (links in red) are not live links.
While none of the pages are editable, viewers are invited to leave comments using the 'Discussion' tab for a given page.
Further information about the MetaNet project, as well as links to selected publications can be accessed via the MetaNet webpage: https://metanet.icsi.berkeley.edu/metanet/

revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. * Metaphor names should be in all caps
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on category=Metaphor}} The list of metaphors is now found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]]. A list of metaphor families can be found here: [[Metaphor Families]] Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Level | Metaphor Level]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Type | Metaphor Type]]
[[Property:Inference | Metaphor Inference]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Source frame | Source Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Target frame | Target Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Alias.Provenance | Provenance]]
[[Property:Status | Status]]
[[Property:Entered by | Entered by]]
[[Property:Last reviewed by | Last Reviewed]]
[[Property:Mapping | Mappings]]
==Metaphor Standards== Refer to the [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Standards Standards page] for guides on capitalization, citation, and so on.

A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] To export all the metaphors and frames in RDF/OWL: [[Export Metaphors and Frames]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. * Metaphor names should be in all caps
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on namespace=Metaphor|namespace=Metaphor}} The Glossary (work in progress, only for Analysis Team) The list of metaphors is now found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]]. A list of metaphor families can be found here: [[Metaphor Families]] Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]] ([[Detailed Frame Families|with LUs]]). Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] To export all the metaphors and frames in RDF/OWL: [[Export Metaphors and Frames]] A graph of relations between all the metaphors in the repository is here: [[Map of all metaphors]] (currently too big to be intelligible) Summary of proposed links from linguistic to conceptual metaphors: [[LM to CM Linking Summary]] (very slow) ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[List of primary metaphors|Primary metaphors]] * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Frames with filled fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] * [[Metaphors listed by tags]] * [[Metaphor Lists for Status Reports]] * [[CMs with examples]] * [[CMs with LMs|CMs with all LM examples]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Level | Metaphor Level]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Type | Metaphor Type]]

[[Property:Metaphor.Source frame | Source Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Target frame | Target Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Alias.Provenance | Provenance]]
[[Property:Status | Status]]
[[Property:Entered by | Entered by]]
[[Property:Last reviewed by | Last Reviewed]]
[[Property:Mapping | Mappings]]
==Metaphor Standards== Refer to the [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Standards Standards page] for guides on capitalization, citation, and so on.
